thread.title: Oceanside, Allen, VanBlarcom work overtime to continue season
thread.title_full: Oceanside, Allen, VanBlarcom work overtime to continue season

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Ken Waltz and Mark Haskell)
title: Oceanside, Allen, VanBlarcom work overtime to continue season
text:
Oceanside, Allen, VanBlarcom work overtime to continue season Mariners stun higher-ranked Nokomis in prelim, move on in playoffs By Ken Waltz and Mark Haskell | Oct 17, 2015 
Newport — With a relatively young team, that includes a sprinkling of experienced veterans, Oceanside field hockey players and coaches realized 2015 might be a series of ups and downs, peaks and valleys. 
As predicted, it was, but, in glorious fashion, the Mariners, who finished 5-8-1 during the regular season, realized their dream of qualifying for the Maine Principals' Association Class B North playoffs in the 10th and final spot. 
And then came the highest peak — some may say a spot in the clouds — of the fall when Oceanside hit the road to face No. 7 Nokomis (9-6) and pulled out a stunning, 2-1 overtime win in a Saturday morning, Oct. 17 regional prelim playoff game. 
Oceanside earned its sixth win of the campaign and it came with extra work — and thanks to goals by seniors Mary Allen and Makayla VanBlarcom. 
The Mariners move on to the regional quarterfinals to play at No. 2 Winslow (10-3-1) on Wednesday, Oct. 21 at 3 p.m. 
During the regular season, the Mariners lost to the Nokomis Warriors 2-1, also in overtime, on Sept. 24 in Rockland, while the Mariners and Winslow Black Raiders played to a scoreless, double-overtime tie on Sept. 22 in Rockland. 
“I think we're the only team to hold [Winslow] scoreless,” said veteran Oceanside coach Joanna Hall. “We certainly had our opportunities in overtime in that [earlier] game. Looking at the top four teams [in the region], that's the team we would have picked to play. I'd rather go back to Winslow and settle that unfinished business there.” 
The Mariners earned the opportunity to play Winslow with Saturday's exciting prelim playoff win over Nokomis. 
Oceanside led 1-0 at halftime as VanBlarcom scored with 3:43 left. In the second half, Emily Pratt scored off a penalty corner for Nokomis with 12:58 remaining. 
To decide the well-played, evenly-matched postseason affair, Allen tallied the game-winner with 1:19 left in the second overtime. 
Oceanside held a 10-8 edge in shots, while Nokomis held a 14-4 advantage in penalty corners. 
Mattie Hooper made six saves in the cage for Oceanside, while Alexis Mazurek made two crucial player-saves for the visitors. Chelsea Crockett made eight saves in goal for Nokomis. 
Hooper played her second straight game for usual starter Lauren Hoppe, who remained out of action with concussion-like symptoms. Coach Hall said Hoppe should be back for the Winslow game, “but who knows?” 
The hosts threatened to end the game in the second OT with three potentially dangerous penalty corners. 
Then came Allen's heroics, thanks, in part, to teammate VanBlarcom. And, of course, Allen's will to push herself physically to the limit to help her team — and herself — keep playing the game they love. 
“She took the ball at about the 50[-yard area of the field], got a pass from Makayla VanBlarcom, and Mary worked it in past the 25, moved a little to the right and shot toward the right across the circle and hit the far corner [of the cage]," Hall said. "I was actually really close to subbing for [Allen] because you could see that she was trying to make her legs move. But she found enough energy to finish the play and she just collapsed after that. She played the whole game for us. The will was there but her body was worn down a little bit.” Courier Publications' sports staff can be reached by email at sports@villagesoup.com or by phone at 594-4401.
